channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown bushes, 5th July
item.description:
Alley way in Radnor overground bushes ETC some parts are difficult to pass urgent needs doing ASAP please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Radnor Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsightly refuse storage and rubbish on the street, 5th July
item.description:
This household stores their refuse and recycling right next to the pavement. It looks awful and the rubbish is often scattered along the road. The general rubbish is in black bags which are in two wheelie bins but do not fit in the bins so are always overflowing with bin lids not shut. Foxes then take the bins out and scatter the contents across the street. This has been going on for months and possibly up to a year. The street is therefore constantly covered in rubbish. Even when the rubbish is not on the street, it looks unsightly stored right next to the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Kevington Drive, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double divan bed and other bedroom furniture fly tipped, 5th July
item.description:
I just witnessed the occupiers of 10 Oslo square fly tipping more of their household furniture. They added this furniture to the bedroom items they fly tipped in the middle of last night. Southwark council workers only collected a fridge and separate freezer fly tipped by the same family two days ago. It would be cheaper for the council (and all of us that pay our taxes) to collect directly from that address on a weekly basis. Please can southwark do something about this problematic family that insists on fly tipping each week even though they drive a very large car (provided by us tax payers) and could easily and safely take the items to the tip
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plover Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in garages, 5th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Clarendon Path, St Paul's Cray, London
